fr.sii.ogham.sms.builder.ovh

Class OvhOptionsBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.sii.ogham.core.builder.AbstractParent<OvhSmsBuilder>
      • fr.sii.ogham.sms.builder.ovh.OvhOptionsBuilder
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    fr.sii.ogham.core.builder.Builder<OvhOptions>, fr.sii.ogham.core.builder.Parent<OvhSmsBuilder>

    public class OvhOptionsBuilder
extends fr.sii.ogham.core.builder.AbstractParent<OvhSmsBuilder>
implements fr.sii.ogham.core.builder.Builder<OvhOptions>
    Configures OVH SMS options:
    • Enable/disable the "STOP" indication at the end of the message (useful to disable for non-commercial SMS)
    • Define the SMS encoding (see SmsCoding): 1 for 7bit encoding, 2 for 8bit encoding (UTF-8). If you use UTF-8, your SMS will have a maximum size of 70 characters instead of 160
    • Define a tag to mark sent messages (a 20 maximum character string)
    Author:
    Aur√©lien Baudet

    • Constructor Detail

      • OvhOptionsBuilder

        public OvhOptionsBuilder(OvhSmsBuilder parent,
                         fr.sii.ogham.core.builder.env.EnvironmentBuilder<?> environmentBuilder)
        Initializes the builder with a parent builder. The parent builder is used when calling AbstractParent.and() method. The EnvironmentBuilder is used to evaluate properties when build() method is called.
        Parameters:
        parent - the parent builder
        environmentBuilder - the configuration for property resolution and evaluation

    • Method Detail

      • noStop

        public OvhOptionsBuilder noStop(String... noStop)
        Enable/disable "STOP" indication at the end of the message (useful to disable for non-commercial SMS).

        You can specify one or several property keys. For example: 

         .soStop("${custom.property.high-priority}", "${custom.property.low-priority}");
        The properties are not immediately evaluated. The evaluation will be done when the build() method is called. If you provide several property keys, evaluation will be done on the first key and if the property exists (see EnvironmentBuilder), its value is used. If the first property doesn't exist in properties, then it tries with the second one and so on.
        Parameters:
        noStop - one value, or one or several property keys
        Returns:
        this instance for fluent chaining

      • noStop

        public OvhOptionsBuilder noStop(Boolean noStop)
        Enable/disable "STOP" indication at the end of the message (useful to disable for non-commercial SMS).
        Parameters:
        noStop - enable or disable (no effect if null)
        Returns:
        this instance for fluent chaining

      • tag

        public OvhOptionsBuilder tag(String... tag)
        Set a tag to mark sent messages (20 maximum character string). You can specify a direct value. For example: 
         .tag("my tag");

        You can also specify one or several property keys. For example: 

         .tag("${custom.property.high-priority}", "${custom.property.low-priority}");
        The properties are not immediately evaluated. The evaluation will be done when the build() method is called. If you provide several property keys, evaluation will be done on the first key and if the property exists (see EnvironmentBuilder), its value is used. If the first property doesn't exist in properties, then it tries with the second one and so on.
        Parameters:
        tag - one value, or one or several property keys
        Returns:
        this instance for fluent chaining

      • smsCoding

        public OvhOptionsBuilder smsCoding(String... smsCoding)
        Set the message encoding:
        • 1 for 7bit encoding
        • 2 for 8bit encoding (UTF-8)
        If you use UTF-8, your SMS will have a maximum size of 70 characters instead of 160 You can specify one or several property keys. For example: 
         .smsCoding("${custom.property.high-priority}", "${custom.property.low-priority}");
        The properties are not immediately evaluated. The evaluation will be done when the build() method is called. If you provide several property keys, evaluation will be done on the first key and if the property exists (see EnvironmentBuilder), its value is used. If the first property doesn't exist in properties, then it tries with the second one and so on.
        Parameters:
        smsCoding - one value, or one or several property keys
        Returns:
        this instance for fluent chaining

      • smsCoding

        public OvhOptionsBuilder smsCoding(SmsCoding smsCoding)
        Set the message encoding:
        • SmsCoding.NORMAL: 7bit encoding
        • SmsCoding.UTF_8: 8bit encoding (UTF-8)
        If you use UTF-8, your SMS will have a maximum size of 70 characters instead of 160
        Parameters:
        smsCoding - the SMS encoding
        Returns:
        this instance for fluent chaining
